item.title: A discord cmd to receive a link, and create a brainery fleeting note
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)

item.title: Tech radar status report
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Create a Discord bot to send notification to a channel when status of a radar item change or a new research or experiment has been made for the blip. Acceptance criteria Only apply for item with priority FOCUS or NEW Send the message [Radar item]'s status has changed from [status A] to [status B]. Check out [link]. when a radar item has changed its status Send the message [Radar item] [status]: [User] did [Task's name] at [Link] when a new research or experiment has added to a radar timeline This bot can be easily embedded to any channel Relevant links:

item.title: wagmi website, fork xkcd, with crm for img uploading
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Background Developers working on Javascript Applications often face the challenge of enforcing type safety between the client and server. One effective solution is to automatically generate an OpenAPI Spec file from server code. This can then be used with the OpenAPI generator to produce a client-side library for making typesafe API calls to the backend. Our existing workflow has adopted the typesafe approach using Swagger for API documentation. We aim to upgrade this approach by automating the generation of API methods.

item.title: ?trend command
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Requirements ?trend command The idea is to create a ?trend Discord command that will list the top 15 trending repositories on GitHub. We can reference https://github.com/trending to make our list. Otherwise, we will need to identify what should count as trending on our end (stars/day, commits/day, etc). There are no particular design requirements for this command, but it should use an embed and look similar to the outputs of our other commands.

item.title: Brainery metrics report
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Collect & persist brainery post in discord channel. — Create a discord bot and a command to display weekly report from our Brainery. Following are the data we want to see: Weekly count for new posts Weekly tags Weekly contributors Weekly new contributors Acceptance criteria A bot reports the numbers to our #metrics channel and any channel we want to config (#aa for example) A command with a default option to show weekly metrics (open to change the param to monthly,…).

item.title: Tech radar status report
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Create a Discord bot to send notification to a channel when status of a radar item change or a new research or experiment has been made for the blip. Acceptance criteria Only apply for item with priority FOCUS or NEW Send the message [Radar item]'s status has changed from [status A] to [status B]. Check out [link]. when a radar item has changed its status Send the message [Radar item] [status]: [User] did [Task's name] at [Link] when a new research or experiment has added to a radar timeline This bot can be easily embedded to any channel Relevant links:

item.title: Add new discord command to publish new brainery post
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Input: ?brainery post (optional, default: 10) <github_id>(optional) Output: Same with current Brainery post
